Package edu.wit.scds.comp2000.queue.app

Class Passenger

java.lang.Object
edu.wit.scds.comp2000.queue.app.Passenger
public final class Passenger
extends java.lang.Object
Representation of an individual who will travel via train between origin and destination stations.

NOTE: You may use this class, with or without modification, in your Comp 2000, Queue application/Train Simulation solution. You must retain all authorship comments. If you modify this, add your authorship and modification history tags after the existing tags.

Version:
1.0.0 initial version, 1.0.1 minor fixes (don't affect behaviors), 2.0.0 2021-10-30
  • restructure to use simulation callback instead of parameter passing
  • major restructuring
  • clean up
Author:
David M Rosenberg

  • Constructor Details

    • Passenger

      public Passenger​(Station initialOrigin, Station initialDestination)
      Parameters:
      initialOrigin - station where this passenger starts its journey
      initialDestination - station where this passenger ends its journey

  • Method Details

    • getOrigin

      public Station getOrigin()
      Retrieves the origin station
      Returns:
      the station where this passenger began its journey

    • setOrigin

      Station setOrigin​(Station newOrigin)
      Sets the origin station

      WARNING: changing this once the passenger has entered the simulation may corrupt the results

      Parameters:
      newOrigin - the passenger's origin
      Returns:
      the previous origin

    • getDestination

      public Station getDestination()
      Retrieves the destination station
      Returns:
      the station where this passenger will end its journey

    • setDestination

      Station setDestination​(Station newDestination)
      Sets the destination station

      WARNING: changing this once the passenger has entered the simulation may corrupt the results

      Parameters:
      newDestination - the passenger's destination
      Returns:
      the previous destination

    • getTimeEntered

      public int getTimeEntered()
      Retrieves the time the passenger started its journey
      Returns:
      the start time

    • setTimeEntered

      int setTimeEntered​(int newTimeEntered)
      Set the time the passenger started its journey

      WARNING: changing this once the passenger has entered the simulation may corrupt the results

      NOTE: should be set by travel operation methods

      Parameters:
      newTimeEntered - the value to use for the journey start time
      Returns:
      the previous value of started time

    • getTimeBoarded

      public int getTimeBoarded()
      Retrieves the time the passenger boarded a train
      Returns:
      the time boarded

      WARNING: changing this once the passenger has entered the simulation may corrupt the results

      NOTE: should be set by travel operation methods

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the previous value of boarded time

    • describe

      public java.lang.String describe()
      Superset of functionality of toString() which includes all instance state
      Returns:
      all instance information formatted for human consumption

    • setSimulationCallback

      static void setSimulationCallback​(TrainSimulation currentSimulation)
      Enable callback to the simulation to access:
      • configuration
      • current time
      • random number generator instance
      • logger
      • train route

      This setup is done once at the start of the simulation for this entire class

      Parameters:
      currentSimulation - instance providing callback functionality

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Test driver
      Parameters:
      args - -unused-
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the configuration file doesn't exist or can't be opened for read access
      java.io.IOException - if the logs folder doesn't exist and can't be created
